title: Messenger ribonucleic acid (mRNA) (nucleoside modified): View Uses, Side Effects and Medicines | 1mg
cleaned_text: The most common side effects of Messenger ribonucleic acid (mRNA) (nucleoside modified) are injection site pain, redness or swelling, fatigue, headache, myalgia, arthralgia, chills, nausea or vomiting, axillary swelling or tenderness, and fever. However, these are mild and usually resolve with time. If they bother you or do not go away, please consult the doctor. The doctor will prescribe some medicines or may suggest ways to cope up with these side effects.
